lang.name: en_CA
lang.key: Maintained by Madison Kelly (mkelly@alteeve.ca) for the APC PDU Scan Agent.
APC/Schneider Electronics PDU Scan Agent
Starting to read the SNMP OIDs for the PDU: [#!variable!pdu!#].
Starting #!string!scan_apc_pdu_brand_0001!#:

-=] APC PDU Scan Agent
DESCRIPTION
This program is a "scan agent" for the ScanCore decision engine, part of the Anvil! Intelligent-availabiltiyâ„¢ system.
It monitors APC/Schneider brand network-connected switched PDUs.
SWITCHES
-h, -?, --help
Show this dialog and exit.
--prep-db
If passed, the schema will be loaded into the database (if not already), even if no APC brand PDUs are found. Note: This won't work if the agent has been manually disabled via 'scan-apc-pdu::disable'.
--pdus <pdu1>[,<pdu2>,...,<pduN>]
Specify the PDU(s) to query. If host names are used, they must be convertable to IP addresses. Two or more PDUs can be defined using commas and *no* spaces to separate them.
This is optional. By default, the scan agent will read /etc/hosts and any entries with a host name containing 'pdu' will be checked. If you are not using /etc/hosts, then be sure to set:
scancore::agent::scan-apc-pdu::switches::pdu = <pdu1>[,<pdu2>,...,<pduN>]
This will tell ScanCore to call this agent using this switch.
SUPPORT
https://alteeve.ca/w/Support
Alteeve's Niche!
No APC/Schneider brand PDUs found, exiting.
Connection to the PDU: [#!variable!pdu_name!#] has been lost!
Connection to the PDU: [#!variable!pdu_name!#] has been restored.
Down

A new PDU: [#!variable!name!# has been found - Serial Number: .............. [#!variable!serial_number!#] - Model Number: ............... [#!variable!model_number!#] - Manufacture Date: ........... [#!variable!manufacture_date!#] - Firmware version: ........... [#!variable!firmware_version!#] - Hardware version: ........... [#!variable!hardware_version!#] - IP Address: ................. [#!variable!ipv4_address!#] - MAC Address: ................ [#!variable!mac_address!#] - MTU Size: ................... [#!variable!mtu_size!#] Bytes - Link Speed: ................. [#!variable!link_speed_mbps!#] (#!variable!link_speed_hr!#) - Number of phases:............ [#!variable!phase_count!#] - Max amps per phase: ......... [#!variable!phase_max_amperage!#] - Low amp warning: ............ [#!variable!phase_low_amp_warning!#] - High amp warning: ........... [#!variable!phase_high_amp_warning!#] - High amp critical: .......... [#!variable!phase_high_amp_critical!#] - Number of outlets: .......... [#!variable!outlet_count!#]
- Phase: [#!variable!phase!#] current amperage:[#!variable!amps!#]
- Outlet: [#!variable!outlet!#], on phase: [#!variable!on_phase!#] is: [#!variable!state!#] (name: [#!variable!name!#])
The model number of the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_model_number!#] -> [#!variable!new_model_number!#]
The manufacure date of the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_manufacture_date!#] -> [#!variable!new_manufacture_date!#]
The manufacure date of the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_manufacture_date!#] -> [#!variable!new_manufacture_date!#]
The uptime of the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has increased; [#!variable!old_uptime!#] -> [#!variable!new_uptime!#]
The PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has rebooted! The uptime changed; [#!variable!old_uptime!#] -> [#!variable!new_uptime!#]
The wattage draw through the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_total_wattage_draw!#] -> [#!variable!new_total_wattage_draw!#]
The firmware on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_firmware_version!#] -> [#!variable!new_firmware_version!#]
The hardware version on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_hardware_version!#] -> [#!variable!new_hardware_version!#]
The IP address on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_ipv4_address!#] -> [#!variable!new_ipv4_address!#]
The MAC address on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_mac_address!#] -> [#!variable!new_mac_address!#]
The MTU size on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_mtu_size!#] Bytes -> [#!variable!new_mtu_size!#] Bytes
We've regained access to the PDU: [#!variable!name!#]. The new link speed is: [#!variable!new_link_speed_mbps!#] (#!variable!new_link_speed_hr!#)
The link speed to the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_link_speed_mbps!#] (#!variable!old_link_speed_hr!#) -> [#!variable!new_link_speed_mbps!#] (#!variable!new_link_speed_hr!#)
The number of phases on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_phase_count!#] -> [#!variable!new_phase_count!#]
The number of outlets on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_outlet_count!#] -> [#!variable!new_outlet_count!#]
The maximum amperage on the phase: [#!variable!phase!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_outlet_count!#] -> [#!variable!new_outlet_count!#]
The amperage draw on phase: [#!variable!phase!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_phase_current_amperage!#] -> [#!variable!new_phase_current_amperage!#]
The phase number: [#!variable!phase!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has returned.
The phase number: [#!variable!phase!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has vanished!
The amperage drawing theough phase: [#!variable!phase!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] is below the low-warning threshold!
The amperage drawing theough phase: [#!variable!phase!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] is back below the high critical alert threshold.
The amperage drawing theough phase: [#!variable!phase!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] is back below the high warning alert threshold.
The amperage drawing theough phase: [#!variable!phase!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] is critically high! If the load increases much further, power output may be lost! Reduce load immediately!
The amperage drawing theough phase: [#!variable!phase!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] is back above the low-warning threshold.
The amperage drawing theough phase: [#!variable!phase!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has risen above the high warning alert threshold. Be careful about adding any further load on this PDU.
The outlet number: [#!variable!outlet!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has vanished!
A new outlet: [#!variable!outlet!#] was found on the PDU: [#!variable!pdu_name!#], on phase: [#!variable!on_phase!#] and it is: [#!variable!state!#] (name: [#!variable!name!#])
The outlet number: [#!variable!outlet!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has returned.
The name of the outlet: [#!variable!outlet!#] on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_outlet_name!#] -> [#!variable!new_outlet_name!#]
The phase that the outlet: [#!variable!outlet!#], on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] is on has changed; [#!variable!old_outlet_on_phase!#] -> [#!variable!new_outlet_on_phase!#]
The state of the outlet: [#!variable!outlet!#], on the PDU: [#!variable!name!#] has changed; [#!variable!old_outlet_state!#] -> [#!variable!new_outlet_state!#] - Was the down-stream node fenced?
The PDU model: [#!variable!model!#] with the serial number: [#!variable!serial_number!#] at the IP address: [#!variable!ip_address!#] has vanished! - Did the network cable come unplugged?
The PDU model: [#!variable!model!#] with the serial number: [#!variable!serial_number!#] at the IP address: [#!variable!ip_address!#] has returned.
